New Records: Emiliano Martinez has now played 45 times in goal for Argentina. He has kept 33 clean sheets.
This was the first time in 87 years that a Copa America final ended in extra time
Lautaro Martinez's winning goal in extra time was his fifth goal of 2024 Copa America, earning him the Golden Boot.
Key Match Events: Lautaro Martinez scored the winning goal in the 112th minute of extra time.
Lionel Messi was forced off with an apparent leg injury in the 66th minute.
Leandro Paredes made four tackles during his time on the pitch, more than any of his teammates throughout the match.
Pre-Game Insights: The match was delayed by more than an hour due to chaotic and dangerous scenes preventing fans from entering the stadium.
Colombia led the tournament in goals scored with 12 across their seven matches but failed to find the net for the first time in the final.
Post-Match Reflections: Lionel Scaloni praised the team for overcoming difficulties and improving in the second half.
Nestor Lorenzo, Colombia's coach, congratulated Argentina and expressed hope for future success.
Angel Di Maria stated he would always be grateful to this generation of players who helped him achieve his goals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Thousands of fans were prevented from entering the Hard Rock Stadium in Miami.
This was the first time Argentina won a major tournament without Di Maria scoring a goal.
Others: Argentina conceded only one goal in this tournament, becoming just the fourth team ever to play at least five matches and concede one or zero goals.
